intro: Cyrtandra minjemensis, commonly known as the Minjemensis Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the island of Java. This species is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
